meanings.definition: Having a particular kind of mind or inclination
meanings.sent1: She is a science-minded student who loves conducting experiments.
meanings.sent2: He is a detail-minded person who always notices small things.
meanings.sent3: The art-minded child created a masterpiece using only crayons.
meanings.sent4: The music-minded teacher conducted the class like a symphony orchestra.
meanings.sent5: The adventure-minded group decided to explore the mysterious cave.

meanings.definition: Paying attention to or considering something
meanings.sent1: She minded her manners at the dinner table.
meanings.sent2: He always minds his own business and doesn't gossip.
meanings.sent3: The cat minded the mouse curiously, but didn't pounce.
meanings.sent4: The detective minded every detail of the crime scene.
meanings.sent5: Please mind the step as you enter the bus.

meanings.definition: Having a specified attitude or intention
meanings.sent1: He is safety-minded and always wears a helmet when biking.
meanings.sent2: She is career-minded and focused on advancing in her job.
meanings.sent3: The adventure-minded group planned a spontaneous trip to the beach.
meanings.sent4: The goal-minded athlete trained hard to win the competition.
meanings.sent5: The environmentally-minded family recycles and conserves energy.
